HelpXML.Title: basicPower
HelpXML.Purpose: basicPower computes the basic power transformation

Item.Name: Y
Item.LongDesc: n x v data matrix; n observations and v variables. Rows of Y represent observations, and columns represent variables. Missing values (NaN's) and infinite values (Inf's) are allowed, since observations (rows) with missing or infinite values will automatically be excluded from the computations.

Item.Name: ColtoTra
Item.LongDesc: k x 1 integer vector specifying the variables which must be transformed. If it is missing and length(la)=v all variables are transformed

Item.Name: la
Item.LongDesc: k x 1 vector containing set of transformation parameters for the k ColtoTra.

Item.Name: Ytra
Item.LongDesc:
n x v data matrix containing transformed observations
When $\lambda \ne 0$ \[ ytra = y^\lambda \] else \[ ytra = log(y) \]

References.Item: Box, G. E. P. & Cox, D. R. (1964). An analysis of transformations (with Discussion). J. R. Statist. Soc. B 26, 211-252
